m_szDocTitle: Mercedes Aims For 60 Mile Range From Its Plug-in Hybrid Cars - Gas 2
m_szDocSumamry: Mercedes Aims For 60 Mile Range From Its Plug-in Hybrid Cars January 20th, 2016 by Steve Hanley     Mercedes plans to introduce 10 plug-in hybrid cars in the US market by the end of 2017. All of them will have a relatively modest electric only range of 20 miles or so. In a recent interview with Australia’s Motoring at the Detroit auto show last week, Mercedes R&D chief said that his company expects to exceed the 60 mile (100 km) barrier with its next generation plug-in cars.
